section.name: General Settings
section.description: This contains general format settings for this publication.

setting.name: Measurement Unit
setting.description: The unit of measurement used in this publication.

setting.name: Source Encoding Transform
setting.description: In the case of multi-script projects or non-Unicode, an encoding transformation may be needed make the source data useful to the system. The encoding information is stored in the Encoding section and should be the same as other files used in this project. (Default = False)

section.name: Chapter and Verse
section.description: Parameters that cover varous aspects of formating of chapter and verse layout

setting.name: Short Book Chapter Omit
setting.description: If a book consists of a single chapter it is often desirable to not have a chapter number marking the beginning of the book. If set True, this will insert a command in the control file to prevent inserting the chapter number in a single chapter book. Default = True

setting.name: Omit All Chapter Numbers
setting.description: Omit all the chapter numbers in the book. (Actually this is what is done for one-chapter books.) If set to true, this will override the Short Book Chapter Omit setting that is normally used in one chapter books and will take all the chapter numbers out of all books. Default = False

setting.name: Omit Verse Number One
setting.description: Setting this to True will prevent verse number 1 from being displayed which is normally good for in-line verse formated Bibles that use drop chapter numbers. Default = True

setting.name: Chapter Verse Separator
setting.description: Change the default c/v separator character or adjust the space by adding some extra code. For example, to kern the space between the separator character you could enter: "\kern.02em:\kern.02em". This setting primary affects the header reference. Default = ":"

section.name: Columns
section.description: Parameters which have to do with column layout for Scripture publications

setting.name: Title Columns
setting.description: Number of columns used to typeset the main title. Default = 1

setting.name: Intro Columns
setting.description: Number of columns used to typeset introduction material. Introduction material is defined by USFM markers beginning with \i Default = 1

setting.name: Body Columns
setting.description: Number of columns used to typeset the body text. Default = 1

setting.name: Column Gutter Rule
setting.description: Do you want to place a vertical line between the columns in the column gutter? Default = False

section.name: Crossreferences
section.description: This section includes all textual elements that go into the crossreferences area.

setting.name: Include Crossreferences
setting.description: [NOT IMPLEMENTED] Include crossreferences in the output. Defalt = True

setting.name: Use Auto Callers (Crossrefs)
setting.description: Set to true if a symbol or a csv sequence of symbols is needed for crossreferences. Default = True

section.name: Footnotes
section.description: This section includes all textual elements that go into the footnote.

setting.name: Include Footnotes
setting.description: [NOT IMPLEMENTED] Include footnotes in the output. Defalt = True

setting.name: Use Auto Callers (Footnotes)
setting.description: Set to true if a symbol or a csv sequence of symbols is needed for footnotes. Default = True

setting.name: Use Running Header Rule
setting.description: If this is set to true a rule will be placed in the header according to the Running Header Rule Position. Default = False

section.name: Footer Content
section.description: Footer Configuration, leave them empty if you don't want anything to show up in the footer, like page numbers on the title page. The default is leave them all empty. Normally we do not want to put any content in the footer as it takes up an extra line which addes up to extra pages in a publication. It is more efficient to put information like page numbers in the running header.

setting.name: Use Running Footer
setting.description: Set this to true if you want to have a running footer line in your document. (Defalt = False)

section.name: Header Content
section.description: Information to include in the running header (at top of pages, except first) We set the items to print at left/center/right of odd and even pages separately Possible contents: \bookname = the name of the book as defined in \h \rangeref = Scripture reference of the range of text on the page; \firstref = reference of the first verse on the page) \lastref = reference of the last verse on the page) \pagenumber = the page number \empty = print nothing in this position To follow are each of the individual position.

setting.name: Use Running Header
setting.description: Set this to true if you want to have a running header line in your document. (Defalt = True)

section.name: Hyphenation
section.description: Some information for building TeX commands for building the hyphenation control file and other related files located in the project's hyphenation folder. Some file names are stored in this section. These are not used in the makefile process and can vary depending on how the process is run. Note: remember to re-make/overwrite the current TeX Hyphenation file for the changes to take effect.

setting.name: Use Hyphenation
setting.description: Set to true to use hyphenation in the project. Hyphenation is important to any project but it needs to be setup before it can be used. Therefore the default is false Default = False

setting.name: Use Illustrations
setting.description: Illustrations - If set to true this will allow the system to put in place all the files necessary to have illustrations used in this publication. One warning, however, if you choose to set this to false after once using illustrations, it will delete all the illustration related files with the exception of the captions.csv file. This is to prevent errors from occurring during the typesetting process. Default = False

section.name: Page Layout
section.description: Page layout information. This covers general page layout format options.

setting.name: Page Size ID Code
setting.description: If you are using a common page size please enter the standard code. If a custom size is being used just enter "custom". Default = A5

setting.name: Starting Page Number
setting.description: Sometimes the content should not start with the default page number of '1'. If a number is set in this field, the macro will insert a \pageno command in the control file. Note this is for the main content section only. Individual components in the front and back matter must have the \pageno command inserted manually into their control files. Default = Null (which means no command output, page starts on '1')

setting.name: Use Watermark
setting.description: Turn on (or off) the use of a page watermark in this project.

setting.name: Watermark File
setting.description: Watermark default file name. Change this name to indicate what watermark you want put on the page, if you choose to use a watermark.

setting.name: Use Lines
setting.description: Turn on (or off) the use of lines in the background of the page in this project. This is to help with composition work.

setting.name: Lines Background File
setting.description: The default background file used to display lines behind the text, if that feature is selected.

section.name: Text Elements
section.description: General settings for text level elements

setting.name: Justify Paragraphs
setting.description: Paragraphs are justified by default. Set this to false to turn off justification. Default = True

setting.name: Right To Left
setting.description: Uncomment to use right-to-left text layout mode Default = False

section.name: TeX Behavior
section.description: Settings that make TeX behave better

setting.name: Horizontal Fuzz
setting.description: Specify the amount that a horizontal box (hbox) can exceed its natrual size before TeX conciders it to be overfull. The normal Plain TeX default is 0.1pt.

setting.name: Vertical Fuzz
setting.description: Specify the amount that a vertical box (vbox) can exceed its natrual size before TeX conciders it to be overfull. The normal Plain TeX default is 0.1pt.
